page.title: 14GRICKSTONE FARM,HORTON
page.content: Today we went to Grickstone Farm, which belongs to the Duke of Beaufort. The man who farms the land grows wheat and barley and keeps French Charollais and Pedigree Hampshire sheep. The tenants of the house sell farm machinery,keep a few pigs and sheep and collect old farm implements. We were shown the way to the Grickstone, which is very very old, and told about the Long Barrow and how they found it. In 1890 they were ploughing the field and the horse fell down a hole. They found some skeletons and some pottery. We followed the stream through the Seven Mile Plantation. In the next field there was a sign in remembrance of a little house where some people lived who had plague a long time ago. When we came to the airfield we had to look both ways before we crossed the runway.We saw an aeroplane.
